thread.title: Android malware apps might net hackers millions, fool Google Play Store security - newsR
thread.title_full: Android malware apps might net hackers millions, fool Google Play Store security - newsR

author: newsr.in
title: Android malware apps might net hackers millions, fool Google Play Store security - newsR
text: Most of the recent malware-related security reports detailed various threats targeting Apple’s iOS ecosystem, but that doesn’t mean hackers have stopped attacking Android. A new report claims that a sneaky type of malware has been found in various app stores, including Google’s official Play Store. Once installed on the device, the malware is very hard to remove. Its purpose is to flood a handset with advertising and hackers behind the attack might make as much as $4 milliom from the fraudulent app installs. DON’T MISS: iPhone 6s Plus vs. Galaxy Note 5: Real world performance test (it’s not even close) Android developer Cheetah Mobile discovered the new malware apps, which is hidden in existing Android apps that populate various Android »
